intro: Crotalaria bemba, commonly known as the Bemba false nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Crotalaria bemba is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its toxicity requires caution.
